snippet: One of the two front-runners in the election faces charges from the International Criminal Court, while the other says he was cheated out of winning last time in 2007.
abstract: Millions of Kenyans witness for first time presidential debate with hotly contested and anxiously awaited election only three weeks away; two front-runners are Prime Min Raila Odinga, who says he was cheated out of winning in 2007, and Uhuru Kenyatta, who has been charged by International Criminal Court with crimes against humanity.
lead_paragraph: One of the two front-runners in the election faces charges from the International Criminal Court, while the other says he was cheated out of winning last time in 2007.

headline.seo: In Kenya Debate, Odinga and Kenyatta Deplore Ethnic Politics
headline.main: Candidates in Kenya’s First Presidential Debate Condemn Ethnic Politics
headline.print_headline: Candidates in Kenya’s First Presidential Debate Condemn Ethnic Politics

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
